text: <@U9T6R8V70> I was having an issue with datetime fields in HubDB and realized the timezone defaults to GMT. However, when using the dateformat filter the time was was converted to the local timezone set in the portal. I solved by including "GMT" in the timezone parameter.`datetimeformat('%Y-%b-%e', 'GMT')`

Yeah, this was a big pain for me too. So many abandoned registrations. I actually talked with the HubSpot product team a couple weeks ago as they wanted to better understand the issue. Hopefully there's an update coming down the pipeline soon.

The only solution at this point is to use a workflow to send a series of  followup emails to those that meet the criteria...
• "Time registration email was sent" is known
• AND "Registered at" is unknown
Since you can't include the registration link, you can only reference the subject line of the email and the date  it was sent (Time registration email was sent) and ask that they contact you to resend if they can't find it.

delay first email by a day and set workflow goal to...
• "Registered at" is Known
